Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After a long exhausting day in Venice, one would expect a nice comfortable bed and a peaceful environment to reenergize. That is exactly provided here. Very clean rooms, bed and bathroom. Good service and breakfast is filling. Good place to stay with family and children.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay”
Reviews.Author: Brammycot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at villa tiziana for 3 nights. It's only a short 15 min walk from the lido docks and easy to find. There's always a friendly welcome from staff. The room was ground floor and sadly quite dark but the hotel must have been full at the time so we couldnt swap. It was clean though and cosy. The breakfast was fine but no hot menu but plenty of cereals, pastries etc. Overall its a reasonable stay. It's not what we would call a 3 star but fine for a stay while looking round the city, also quite nice to be away from the centre. One thing that did annoy us was the charge of 5 euros for an hours wifi! After paying 80euro a night you would expect it to be free like in the cafes!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: wobblywombats
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through an information/booking place on the road just before Venice island. We were told three stars and quiet. We were given a map with exact location and told of easy parking along a quiet back lane. The hotel is on Lido island and the boat to venice was supposed to be just a few minutes walk. I see this hotel more as a Bed and Breakfast than a three stars. We had difficulties finding it as it was along a back lane insted of the exact cross from the plan. Parking space along the specified back lane was hard to find. You have to catch the bus for the boat to Venice. Of course you can walk there but with the heat, the distance and the knowledge you will be walking all day, you are better catching the bus. The hotel is an old house in a back lane. It is clean and comfortable. The room was small. The beds small but comfortable. The reception was friendly but assertive. They were helpful and gave us tourist advices. Small maintenance problem:The bathroom fan would not switch off unless we cut the power off first for a few minutes then put the card back in the room electricity slot. We forgot to tell them so we can't blame them.The breakfast was good, the waitress friendly and helpful. We could leave our luggages downstairs after checking out while we went to explore Venice. We paid 140 euro for two with breakfast. I don't know if we paid too much, but we did not have a choice and our stay was good. The booking agency was the one with the incorrect information, not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Tiziana”
Reviews.Author: MissWales82
Reviews.Content: Went for a short break to Venice with family. Lido out of season but this was nice as it was relatively quiet compared to the easily accessible Venice. Hotel was OK, my room had a smell of dampness about it (yes, I know it is Venice and there is alot of water around but this wasn't the cause!). Breakfast basic, fruit salad out of a tin in syrup, not fresh. About 15 minute walk to water bus to venice or a bus stop is very near the hotel which will take you to the water bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Hotel with a Homely Feel”
Reviews.Author: roychanyc
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in June 2008 that was held at the Lido Cinema (the congress centre on Lido island of Venice), and selected this hotel because of its proximity â€“ it only takes about 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the congress centre. To my mind, the second nearest hotel to the congress centre is the Westin, which was way beyond my budget. I did read the other reviews before staying at the Tiziana, which I must say caused a bit more alarm than reality. The room that I stayed in was clean, there was air-conditioning, and the bathroom appeared to be newly renovated. There was no internet access though, not even at the lobby, so I had to rely on the internet access provided during the congress. Breakfast was Continental buffet style, consisting of some pasteries, cereal and bread â€“ there were no eggs, fried, bacon or sausages â€“ which I could see caused disappointment to some diners. Coming back to the issue of location, one should be made aware that the hotel is on the island of Lido, and the main attractions of Venice are on Venice island, which takes about half an hour to reach by ferry. That is not to say that staying on Lido island is without merit â€“ other than the fact that the congress centre is located here (which is also the venue for the Venice Film Festival), people from the mainland come over Lido island during the weekends to enjoy the beach, and the public beach takes half an hour by foot to reach from the Tiziana hotel. Some reviewers have complained that the hotel may be a bit difficult to locate, and I would tend to concur with this observation. So, here is how I suggest you get to the hotel: when at Venice airport, buy the Venice card which includes Alilaguna ferry rides. Take the one-hour Alilaguna ferry ride from the airport to Lido island. When you reach the SME ferry stop on Lido island, take a taxi to the hotel, which is only about a 5 minute drive away, and which should cost around Euro $10. The hotel is located on a side road that is off the main road that the bus travels, which explains why the hotel may be a bit difficult to locate for the uninitiated. Once you become more familiar with the place, you can easily take the bus to and fro the ferry stop, and there are a couple of ferries from Lido island that go to the main island (where you can visit St. Markâ€™s place etc.). Finally, to the question of whether I would stay at this hotel again â€“ yes, the hotel is a pleasant place to stay with a homely, laid-back feel, and the surrounding area appears to be crime-free. I would add a caveat, and that is, I would stay here again if there I was attending a congress here. On the other hand, if I were in Venice to visit the attractions, I would instead stay on the main island.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: DublinGirl85
Reviews.Content: This should not be advertised as a 3 star hotel, it is better described as a modest B&B.They also say there 5 min from the boat but it takes over 10 min.They boast 'private beach upon request'. When we asked about this we were told there is a beach down the road, when we asked about the private beach, the rude manager simply pointed in the general direction and told us 'It is too expensive, 150 euro. They also advertise satilite tv, none of which is in english. The rooms are tiny, (there was less than a foot around the bed)Thankfully we were able to change from the original tiny double room we were given to a slightly better twin room after my partner requested, as soon as we seen it. also the walls must be made of paper as you can here when someone in the ajoining rooms uses the bathroom... We had to ask for the remote for the air conditioner, and extra pillows (on which we got one). In general the room were equiped poorly but clean. I would not recomend this 'hotel'

Reviews.Title: “Worst place on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_in_Italy
Reviews.Content: The check-in clerk was rude. There was mold growing on the wall around the windows. There were three boxes of shower caps in bathroom, but all three were empty! When breakfast was served the cappuchino was so watered down, I asked for another. They charged me 5 euro for the pleasure. Still watered down. The manager that checked us out was a bit nicer then his clerk from the afternoon before. I will never stay there again. What a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: cazSheffield
Reviews.Content: Hotel very difficult to find, being miles from the main attractions of Venice and situated on a backalley. The rooms were fine being clean and well decorated but they were very small. Some staff were fine, others rude and unfriendly. Especially the morning waitress who refused to serve crossants, bread or fruit on our second day but after we left served another guest all of these !! Breakfast was terrible. No eggs, ham , cheese or fresh fruit. Just bread, croissants ( 1 each), crackers and tinned fruit. On our second day not even bread, crackers or fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found hotel staff to be friendly and helpful. Cannot understand previous bad reviews, perhaps folk are expecting luxury 5* hotel treatment when they book a 3* bed and breakfast. Hotel situated on a small lane off the main road within 15/20 mins walk of the Lido water bus station. If this is too strenuous then the are 3 buses (A, B & C) from a nearby bus stop that drops you off at the water bus landing stage. Rooms and bathrooms very clean. Would stay again in the future. If you are holidaying in Venice recommend buying a Venice Card. This saves a lot of hassle queueing for water bus tickets and saves money in the long run. Check the prices on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sinoronaldo
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. The rooms are pokey especially the bathroom which didn't have enough room to swing my arms let alone a cat. The manager refused to put on the air con when it was too muggy because it was October and it was too noisy if the window was left open. Breakfast was terrible. Milk and fruit juices were diluted! Manager was mean and rude and his staff equally unfriendly. Location was not too good either being in Lido and it was a 15 min walk to the vaporetto. Should be a one star B&B not a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Amigo603
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled to Venice in October and we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. This hotel was hidden in a side road off the main street which is quiet difficult to find even with a map. The building was a bit run down and the twin room was smaller than average. The air-conditioning system was switched off during our stay. The room was unpleasantly warm and stuffy. We opened our window for the first night and ended up having one hour sleep because the noise from the traffic was horrible! The bathroom was resonably clean but they did not replace used soap and shampoo. I understand they do not do their own laundary but their towel did not smell fresh at all. Breakfast was perhaps the weakest of all. Dont expect any cooked breakfast. They only served basic continental breakfast. I personally did not find the staff friendly nor helpful. My friend took a piece of biscuit from breakfast bar back to our room and the next day we got told off in the lounge. We asked whether we could leave our luggage in the hotel after checking out. They staff replied quite sarcastically that most people take their luggage after they checked out. Unless you have no alternative in the whole Venice I do not recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tricia123
Reviews.Content: This was a nice surprise. We decided to stay on Lido rather than in Venice, as it is quieter. The hotel was very clean, the staff friendly, and the hotel was charming but also with modern conveniences. It is a little off the beaten track, but was worth it for a good night of quiet sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Tiziana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via A Gritti 3, 30126 Venice, Italy
